txt.en: 'But you are different, yes?'
'A cage? No, this is not a cage.'
'These bars are for my friend's protection!'
'He has been troubled of late. I hope you will be able to ease his mind.'
'Let Gultháva's curtain ebb!'
'There is some enchantment upon this grotto. I can feel it.'
'The chamber lies ahead. Be not afraid.'
'What have you done to Gultháva?'
'She is my friend. She is my only friend.'
A piercing scream shatters the stillness!
'I do not. I have never...'
Walk with Gultháva inside Kidzul-kâlah
'I am... so tired...'
'I... do not...'
'It is... the sceptre of...'
'My father.'
'I... I remember...'
Make your way through the torrential passage to the chamber where Gultháva keeps her friend
'We mean you no harm.'
'Intruders! Invaders! Leave us in peace!'
'A darkness has settled upon these lands. Can you speak of it?'
'He was in such pain when I found him.'
Gandalf, Elrond, and Glorfindel have entered Kidzul-kâlah and wants you to lead them to Gultháva's friend.
'Only I can ease his torment!'
DNT - Blah!
'Let him forget! Let him forget!'
'He is gone... you have taken him from me...'
DNT - Blah!
'Are you so concerned for your jailer?'
'It is time, Lord Elrond.'
'Make your test!'
'Release him from this slumber, Gultháva!'
Talk to Gultháva, the Maiden of the Gladden
Gultháva has released the enchantment that sealed the chamber in which her friend resides, deep within Kidzul-kâlah.
You have earned the trust of Gultháva, the Maiden of the Gladden, and she has brought you into Kidzul-kâlah with the hope that you will be a comfort to her friend.
Hurry back down the torrential passage and find Gultháva
'I have not allowed anyone to see my friend for many a span of years. Perhaps your visit will be a comfort to him.'
Talk to Elrond in the torrential passage
Lead Gandalf and the Elves to Gultháva's friend

'I have spent some time in discussion with Gandalf, and he persuaded me to join him as he unravels this mystery. I do not believe we will find that for which he hopes, but I have brought the sceptre of Annúminas with me at his request.\n\n'The keeper of this place sought to bar our passage. I grieve to cause her such pain, but we must know what she has sealed within Kidzul-kâlah.'

'Who... are you? Have you come to let me out? I have been here... for a long time.'

The shade looks around the grotto with evident confusion.

'I think I meant to leave, but whenever I set my mind to it I am overcome by such drowsiness. I should ask Gultháva about it....'
Talk to the shade of Isildur in Gultháva's secret grotto

'I see the faces of those I knew... but that was so long ago. There was war, and it seemed it would never end. And yet it did... at last there was an ending, but...

'Peace? No... it did not last. I remember... I remember...

'I remember death! Treachery and death! I swam... there was an island in the river... an island....'

'You have done me a cruelty! In return I demand this of you: harm him not! If you can bring him peace, I charge you with the accomplishment of it!

'There are those who seek to do him ill: forces of evil, servants of a powerful darkness. I brought him here to give him safety from them, and I sang my slumbering song so he might find rest. I knew it could not last, and I wept, but I wanted only to keep him safe. That is all I ever wanted.

'Beware his foes, cruel stranger. A shade stalks among the foetid pools, and dread follows in his train; he seeks my friend, and I have long kept him away. Now that you have broken my protections, you must take up the mantle in his defence. If you should fail, my wrath shall be as the deluge, and will wash you away in the torrent!'

'Gandalf's suspicion proved correct, [placeholder]. I did not think it could be so, but when I beheld him with my own eyes I could not deny it. The shade of Isildur remained after his death, and Gultháva kept him hidden from friend and foe alike. But what can have bound him here beyond the span of his life? There is more to learn of this matter.\n\n'He spoke of an island in the river. He must have returned to Tol Send. Go there and speak with him, and then return to the Beorninghús with what you have learned.'
In appearance, Gultháva's friend puts you in mind of Vágari the Wanderer, but whereas that shade filled you with a sense of dread, this one does not.
Climb one of the paths up to the centre of the grotto
'She seems pleasant enough.'
Talk to Gultháva's friend
'Turn your face to me, shade.'
'Can it be?'
'Do you know what this is?'
'My mind is terribly confused, stranger.'
'Listen to me, shade.'
'I have had such terrible dreams of late.'
'You know what I bear, and you know to whom it belonged.'
'Was there a war? I think there was war.'
Gultháva's friend has been revealed to be the shade of Isildur, long kept imprisoned in a secret grotto behind Kidzul-kâlah.
'I think you do. Gultháva seeks to hide it from you.'
'But I know Gultháva wishes to keep me safe.'
'What do I carry, shade?'
'Whenever I am troubled, she sings a song of slumbering...'
Gultháva mourns the disappearance of her friend, the shade she held captive for so long.
'Name it, and I will speak your own name.'
'...and I forget.'
'I name you Isildur, eldest son of Elendil, once the High King of Arnor and Gondor!'
'Where is she?'
'...Gultháva?'
Instance: Only Half-Remembered
'We do not wish to cause you distress, spirit.'
The Maiden of the Gladden is inside Kidzul-kâlah.
'There you are, [placeholder].'
'This is not a mercy to him, Gultháva.'
'Lead the way, [placeholder]. Let us see what Gultháva has been hiding here.'
'He was a man, Gultháva. Just a man.'
DNT - Blah!
'You cannot give him the rest he needs.'
Smooth paths of crushed stones climb to a rocky platform in the centre of the odd chamber.
DNT - Blah!
A piercing scream shattered the stillness! Has something happened to Gultháva?
Gandalf the Wizard and the Elf-lords Elrond and Glorfindel have come to the flooded passages of Kidzul-kâlah.
'Intruders! Interlopers! Invaders!'
'It means to harm my friend!'
'I will not allow it!'
A piercing scream shatters the stillness!
Visitors unlooked-for have come to Kidzul-kâlah!
Listen to Gultháva's friend
Stand with Elrond as he speaks with Gultháva
Gultháva's friend has been revealed to be the shade of Isildur, long kept imprisoned in a secret grotto behind Kidzul-kâlah.
Talk to Gultháva in her secret grotto
A sensation of peaceful slumber fills the grotto
Shade of Isildur
The shade is reminiscent of Vágari, but possesses none of the Wanderer's dread
Remain alert in the secret grotto
'Sometimes creatures come to these ruins.'
'I ensure they do not enter the chamber where my friend is kept.'
